instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turn on & off loop
threads.message:
Hello everybody

I am working on liquid damaged macbook air.Some one cleaned board, cant see burned items or corrosion.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 8V and stable
<SIGNAL>PP3V42V_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.3V and stable
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_GEH</SIGNAL> 2.98V and stable
<SIGNAL>P5VS3_EN_R</SIGNAL> - 3v and 0v up and down


Note: Fan spin and stop contuniusly, usb mouse led is also turn on and off..

 
What can i do next step?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turn on & off loop
threads.message: Do you have CPU Vcore?? Check for corrosion or missing components around SPI......

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turn on & off loop
threads.message:
Hi
Thanks Aprendiz solved problem when fixed damaged SPI line..
